page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: Our 4 by 3 kilometre area is situated to the east of the cathedral city of Ely,Cambridgeshire.It is part of Fenland and has a peat soil which is black.These black fens start a few miles north of Cambridge and almost reach to Peterborough in the west and Wisbech in the north. Our area is very flat,almost hedgeless and treeless,with islands of higher ground where towns and villages have been built.The cathedral in Ely dominates the skyline. The River Ouse runs north-south in the north-west corner of our area.The railway line crosses it at right angles.An embankment runs west-north-west across our area.There is a small village and factory.Arable farming is the main occupation and there are four farms.
